Independent Safety Assessor
Independent safety assessment is the
formation of a judgement, separate and
independent from any system design,
development or operational personnel,
that the safety requirements for the
system are appropriate and adequate for
the planned application and that the
system satisﬁes those safety
requirements. A person who carries out
independent safety assessment is known
as an independent safety assessor or ISA.

body, providing independent assessment and
certiﬁcation services for systems, products,
processes and services related to the railway
infrastructure, and rolling stock as prescribed by
CENELEC norms. The accreditation process is in
full compliance with: ISO / IEC 17020
ISO / IEC 17065:2012
IEC 17020 ISO
IEC 17065

What We Do?
We offer to our customers all fundamental
services for certiﬁcation and inspection, needed
to obtain the authorisation for placing rail
components, subsystems, vehicles and
infrastructure into service, as required to meet
national and European regulatory requirements
and to compete in a global marketplace.

In carrying out independent safety
assessment, the key tasks are:
- Acquiring an appreciation of the
scope and context of the assessment
- Selecting and planning a
cost-effective assessment strategy
- Gathering relevant evidence
- Forming a judgement
- Managing any outcomes 02

Our Mission
Our mission is to bring the expected conﬁdence
level to provide assurance of safety of a
transportation system or one of its components
while we guarantee to be sufﬁciently
independent that there is nothing that might
affect or call into question our ability to carry out
an impartial assessment or to make impartial
judgements regarding safety.

Who uses
Independent
Safety Assessors?
Anyone who needs or wants an
independent assessment of safety.
Reasons include:

- To comply with a standard that requires an ISA
- To be assured that a contractor’s product is safe
- To assure your customer that what your product is safe
- To assure yourself that your product is safe
- To demonstrate to a regulator that your product is safe
- To have the possibility to export your products all over the world

Company Policy
Senior Management of ISALAB Srl, is aware and
conscious of the fact that the Company Policy is
an important element which contributes to the
corporate image and reputation. The Company
undertakes measures to ensure that this policy is
implemented correctly:

- Correct provision of the services provided to its Customers,
guaranteeing their quality and satisfying the contractual
requirements in their entirety.
- Compliance with applicable laws, standards and regulations,
including the Code of Ethics.
- Complete customer assistance, even in the event of problems or
complaints.
- All personnel involved are not subject to any external and / or
internal commercial, ﬁnancial or other pressures that may affect the
quality of the service. 08

- Qualiﬁed staff contribute to compliance with the
aforementioned points by signing the code of ethics and the
various conﬁdentiality agreements.
- Policies and methods applied for full compliance impartiality and
conﬁdentiality are applied and respected.

Senior Management of ISALAB Srl also
emphasizes that the Company Management
System, as well as being an important tool for
maintaining the level of quality achieved, is aimed
at ensuring the constant improvement of the
quality level of the service and the objectives set,
minimizing, where possible and economically
sustainable, any negative impact on the
environment and / or its activities. All this
contributes to promoting trust in the market and
increases credibility towards companies, clients
and end users. 09
